intro: Anil elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anil, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
